channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Microsoft ports the Xbox app to Arm-based Windows PCs
item.description: Microsoft has announced that the Xbox app is now available on all Arm-based Windows 11 PCs. The app's release follows an update Microsoft made to its Prism emulator in December 2025, which translates x86 and x64 apps to Arm, and now includes support for AVX and AVX2. Both extensions play a role in making games run efficiently on Windows.Windows on Arm users will be able to use the Xbox app to purchase, download and stream PC games, and Microsoft says that "more than 85 percent of the Game Pass catalog" now runs on Arm PCs. Unlike Valve's SteamOS, Windows on Arm also supports anti-cheat softwar...

item.title: $100 Off Shark Promo Code | This January
item.description: Shark makes some seriously powerful vacuums, from handheld vacs to steam mops. Don’t miss $100 off, 10% off, and more limited-time coupons from WIRED.

item.title: What We Know About the Winter Storm About to Hit the US—and What We Don’t
item.description: A huge portion of the United States is going to be hit with snow or freezing rain this weekend. Exactly where, what, and how much remains uncertain.

item.title: Your Takeout Meal Might Be Packing More Salt Than Advertised
item.description: A new study finds nearly half of labeled takeout meals contain more salt than what the menu claims.

item.title: ‘Fallout’ Just Dropped a Very Intriguing Bombshell
item.description: Episode 6 of the Amazon adaptation's sophomore season points to the arrival of another major faction from the games, with the help of Easter eggs within Easter eggs.

item.title: The US and China Are Collaborating More Closely on AI Than You Think
item.description: WIRED analyzed more than 5,000 papers from NeurIPS using OpenAI’s Codex to understand the areas where the US and China actually work together on AI research.

item.title: Hardware phone keyboards are a fad built on iPhone keyboard frustration — and it might not last
item.description: From Clicks Communicator to Titan 2 Elite, the gadget world is crying out for physical keyboards on their phones, but why?

item.title: Le télescope James-Webb observe une galaxie qui ressemble à la nôtre et qui n’aurait pas dû exister si tôt !
item.description: Armés d’instruments de plus en plus performants, les astronomes repoussent de plus en plus loin les limites de notre Univers. Ou plus exactement de ce que nous connaissons de l'Univers. Le télescope spatial James-Webb a révélé de nombreuses galaxies très anciennes. Parmi elles, une galaxie qui...

item.title: EDF Tempo : une avalanche de jours rouges arrivent
item.description: Avis aux abonnés à l’option Tempo : une avalanche de jours rouges se profile à l’horizon. Plus d’une quinzaine de jours n’ont pas encore été déclenchés depuis le début de la saison hivernale. Les prochaines semaines s’annoncent donc à haut risque. Mieux vaut s’y préparer.

item.title: « Ubisoft tel qu’on le connait n’existe plus » : 6 jeux annulés, studios fermés, restructuration – Ubisoft fait son grand reboot
item.description: C'est le grand chamboulement pour Ubisoft. La firme annonce une immense restructuration. Plusieurs jeux sont annulés, des studios ferment et les employés n'auront plus le droit au télétravail.

item.title: Annulations et reports de jeux, fermetures de studio, réorganisation : l’électrochoc Ubisoft
item.description: Ubisoft, le géant français du jeu vidéo, opère une réorganisation majeure et s'apprête à vivre quelques mois difficiles, entre fermetures de studios, reports et annulations de jeux. Une transformation en profondeur nécessaire, selon la direction, pour « reprendre son leadership créatif » et provoquer un rebond.

item.title: Meta is expanding ads to all users globally
item.description: Threads has grown enough for Meta to fully integrate it into its advertising machine. On Wednesday, the company said that, with the platform now hosting 400 million monthly active users, ads are expanding globally to all users. The inevitable move follows a test in 30 countries early last year.Ads on Threads are powered by Meta's AI-powered advertising system. They'll use the "same level of personalization" (i.e., tracking and profiling) as Facebook and Instagram. Image, video and carousel ad formats will all appear natively in Threads feeds.Meta said the ad expansion will begin next week, but...

item.title: Blue Origin’s satellite internet network TeraWave will move data at 6Tbps
item.description: The network will be designed for enterprise, data center, and government customers and could offer an alternative to SpaceX's Starlink service.

item.title: Hackers have finally made sophisticated AI generated malware – this AI virus was functional in a matter of days and mimicked the work of a three dev teams working 50 hours a week
item.description: VoidLink malware was created by a single developer using an AI agent to do the work of three development teams.

item.title: Zipline charts drone delivery expansion with $600M in new funding
item.description: The startup plans to expand to at least four new U.S. states in 2026.

item.title: For All Mankind returns on March 27 for a fifth season
item.description:
Apple TV+ has become one of the best streaming services for sci-fi, with hits like Pluribus, Severance, Foundation and many more. There are so many shows that it's easy to forget the one that started it all. For All Mankind was the platform's very first attempt at sci-fi and it's finally coming back after two years for season five on March 27. The next season will run for ten episodes on a weekly basis. It concludes on May 29, with new installments dropping each Friday.
What follows are some slight spoilers for the show, so read with caution. The streamer dropped a short teaser to announce th...

item.title: It’s Time for Nvidia to Prove It Can Do More Than Graphics Cards for PCs
item.description: This may be the moment when ARM really takes off on PCs, though it couldn't come at a worse time.

item.title: Stock market steadies after Trump says he won’t forcibly take Greenland
item.description: But some nerves seemed to remain in the market, and the price of gold rose another 1.7% and topped $4,800 per ounce for the first time. The U.S. stock market is steadying following its worst day since October, though some signs of fear remain on Wall Street Wednesday about President Donald Trump’s desire to take Greenland.

item.title: TCL Knocks $1,000 Off One of Our Favorite Mid-Range TVs
item.description: The 65-inch QM8K sees a massive discount, with equally generous markdowns on larger models.

item.title: This Adorable Good Boy Just Got Rare, Life-Saving Brain Surgery
item.description: Six-year-old Woody has recovered well enough to take his daily walks again.

item.title: Minnesota is holding an economic blackout on January 23 to protest ICE: What to know about the ‘Day of Truth and Freedom’
item.description: Labor unions, faith organizations, and local businesses are urging residents statewide to skip work, school, or any shopping on Friday. Labor unions, faith organizations, and local businesses in Minnesota are calling for a statewide “collective pause” this Friday—in which they urge residents not to go to work, school, or do any shopping—in protest of the Trump administration’s aggressive deployment of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents in the Twin Cities and beyond....

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S26 battery pack leak points to Qi2 charging support
item.description: It looks like Samsung is preparing to launch a new Qi2 battery pack for the upcoming Galaxy S26, which is rumored to support the upgraded charging standard. A report from Winfuture shows off leaked images of what appears to be the new accessory, outfitted with a magnetic Qi2 charging ring that delivers up to 15W […]

item.title: How will corporate CSR thrive?
item.description: A new model for business CSR strategy integration Headlines have been challenging in 2025. Companies are under attack publicly and privately for policies viewed as “too progressive” or “woke.” The reality, however, is that most companies have strongly reaffirmed their sustainability commitments but less so their DEI commitments.

item.title: Amazon is adding AI-powered assistant to One Medical
item.description: Amazon is introducing an AI-powered assistant to One Medical, the tech-forward primary care provider it acquired in 2023. Dubbed 'Health AI,' Amazon says the tool "provides 24/7 personalized health guidance based on your medical records." The company says Health AI can explain lab results, help manage medications, and book appointments for patients. Amazon also says it can "analyze images" but doesn't specify whether this means medical imaging or user uploaded photos. While the company specifically says the tool "complements, but does not replace," a patient's healthcare provider, it also vagu...

item.title: Surveillance and ICE Are Driving Patients Away From Medical Care, Report Warns
item.description: A new EPIC report says data brokers, ad-tech surveillance, and ICE enforcement are among the factors leading to a “health privacy crisis” that is eroding trust and deterring people from seeking care.

item.title: OpenEvidence hits $12B valuation, with new round led by Thrive, DST
item.description: The medical info database has doubled in valuation since last raise in October, despite encroachment from model makers.

item.title: Netflix Just Made All Your James Bond Dreams Come True
item.description: Basically every Bond film, from 'Dr. No' to 'No Time to Die,' is now on the streamer.

item.title: I've seen most of 2026's new robot vacuums, and these are the 2 models I can't wait to try
item.description: These are my hot tips for the best robot vacuums of 2026.

item.title: The Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time remake among six games canceled by Ubisoft
item.description: Two high-profile upcoming Ubisoft games have been starting to look more and more like vaporware with each passing year. One of them is Beyond Good & Evil 2, which we were assured is still in development last year. The other is the Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time remake, which is now officially canceled, along with five other games on Ubisoft’s release slate. The news came in a media briefing attended virtually by VGC, in which the French company also announced delays to seven other games as part of a major restructuring. As reported by VGC, the only canceled game currently named by Ubisoft...

item.title: Amazon has launched a massive sale ahead of Presidents' Day —here are 21 deals I'd buy now, including 50% off appliances, TVs, heaters, and more
item.description: Amazon has launched a huge sale ahead of Presidents' Day, and I'm rounding up my 21 favorite deals to buy now, including TVs, appliances, heaters, and more.

item.title: Driving theory test cheats are using Bluetooth earpieces and hidden phones to pass — and after my recent nightmare, I’m not surprised
item.description: The number of learner drivers caught cheating in their driving tests has skyrocketed in the UK as candidates face long waiting times.

item.title: Dépendance aux réseaux sociaux | Snapchat conclut un accord avec une plaignante américaine
item.description: Snapchat a conclu un accord pour clore des poursuites qui devaient le voir comparaître fin janvier aux côtés d’Instagram, TikTok et YouTube, dans le premier d’une série de procès aux États-Unis sur l’impact des réseaux sociaux sur la santé mentale.
